skkcr wrote:

> 1. How to AUTOMATE the a junit testcase where the test methods can be
> tested with expected, unexpected and null method parameters.

Parasoft's JTest automatically generates test case skeletons for the 
null case and standard boundary cases (like 0, false, negative numbers). 
The problem is that JTest can't tell you what the expected result is; 
only a human knows what the method is designed to do.

Agitar's Agitator can observe your code and tell you some of what it 
does, after which you can mark some of those behaviors as "testable" for 
next time.

> 2. Is there a way that the method parameter values can be passed by
> user to junit during the run/design time.

There is a pattern in JUnit 3 called "Parameterized Test Case" that is 
built in to JUnit 4.

> 3. Is white and black box testing possible using Junit.

Yes: it's just a question of which method you invoke when you run your 
test. For white box testing, test the individual objects; for black box 
testing, test the service API or the graphical interface.

> Please let me know if there are any suitable solutions/alternatives in
> Junit.

There are many. Google will help you find them.

Take care.
